thread.title: Israel's Air Force Strikes 220 Hezbollah Targets in Lebanon | Law-Order
thread.title_full: Israel's Air Force Strikes 220 Hezbollah Targets in Lebanon | Law-Order

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Israel's Air Force Strikes 220 Hezbollah Targets in Lebanon | Law-Order
text:
The Israeli Air Force has bombarded 220 Hezbollah targets in Lebanon, including infrastructure sites, launchers, operatives, and weapon storage facilities, as part of ongoing efforts to degrade Hezbollah's capabilities. Devdiscourse News Desk | Jerusalem | Updated: 27-09-2024 02:01 IST | Created: 27-09-2024 02:01 IST
This image is AI-generated and does not depict any real-life event or location. It is a fictional representation created for illustrative purposes only. Country: Israel SHARE In a significant military maneuver, Israel's Air Force has executed approximately 220 strikes against Hezbollah targets in Lebanon over the past 24 hours, according to a military statement on Thursday.
The targeted sites included key infrastructure, launching platforms for projectiles aimed at Israeli territory, Hezbollah operatives, and weapon storage facilities.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) reiterated their commitment to eroding Hezbollah's military capabilities and dismantling its terrorist infrastructure.
(With inputs from agencies.)
